虚を突く: (きょをつく) - to attack the enemy in his unguarded moment
虚を衝く: (きょをつく) - to attack the enemy in his unguarded moment
虚仮にする: (こけにする) - to make a fool of someone
虚仮の後思案: (こけのあとじあん) - hindsight is 20-20 (even for a fool)
虚伝: (きょでん) - false rumor; false rumour
虚偽: (きょぎ) - untrue; falsehood; fiction; deception; vanity
虚偽表示: (きょぎひょうじ) - {law} false representation; misrepresentation; false labelling; misstatement
虚勢を張る: (きょせいをはる) - to bluff; to act brave
虚字: (きょじ) - kanji representing verb or adjective
虚学: (きょがく) - the soft sciences (social science, humanities, etc.)
虚実混交: (きょじつこんこう) - (yoji) mishmash of truth and untruth; mixture of fiction and fact
虚実混淆: (きょじつこんこう) - (yoji) mishmash of truth and untruth; mixture of fiction and fact
虚実皮膜: (きょじつひまく) - (yoji) the difference between truth and fiction in art being very subtle; Art abides in a realm that is neither truth nor fiction
虚宿: (とみてぼし) - Chinese "Emptiness" constellation (one of the 28 mansions)
虚弱体質: (きょじゃくたいしつ) - weak constitution
虚弱児: (きょじゃくじ) - physically weak or sickly child
虚心坦懐: (きょしんたんかい) - (yoji) with an open and calm mind; with no preconceived notions; without reserve; frank; candid
虚心平気: (きょしんへいき) - (yoji) with an open and calm mind; without reserve; with utmost candor; with no preconceived notions
虚数: (きょすう) - complex number; imaginary part; imaginary number
虚構: (kyokou) - ficção, fabricação, invenção; fictício, ficcional, imaginário
虚無僧: (こむそう) - begging Zen priest of the Fuke sect (wearing a sedge hood and playing a shakuhachi flute)
虚無恬淡: (きょむてんたん) - (yoji) rising above the trivia of life and remaining calm and selfless
虚無感: (きょむかん) - sense of emptiness; empty feeling; feeling of meaninglessness
虚空蔵: (こくうぞう) - Akasagarbha (bodhisattva); the Receptacle of Void
虚聞: (きょぶん) - false rumor; false rumour; false reputation
虚脱: (きょだつ) - prostration; lethargy; collapse; despondency
虚脱状態: (きょだつじょうたい) - (yoji) state of lethargy; absolute bewilderment; daze; mental numbness
虚虚実実: (きょきょじつじつ) - (yoji) full of wiles and tricks; match between persons equal in shrewdness mobilizing all the tricks each can muster; shrewdly avoiding the opponent's strong points and attacking its weaknesses
虚虚実実の戦い: (きょきょじつじつのたたかい) - match between persons equal in shrewdness
虚蝉: (うつそみ) - man of this world/the real world/temporal things; (空蝉, 虚蝉 only) cast-off cicada shell/cicada
虚血性心疾患: (きょけつせいしんしっかん) - ischemic heart disease; ischaemic heart disease
虚説: (きょせつ) - groundless rumor; groundless rumour
虚静: (きょせい) - calm and free of ambition or care
虚鯊: (ウロハゼ) - Glossogobius olivaceus (species of goby)
虜: (ryo) - captive , captive, prisoner; victim (de amor, etc.), slave (to one's lust, etc.)
虞犯: (ぐはん) - likelihood of committing a crime; pre-delinquent
虞犯少年: (ぐはんしょうねん) - juvenile likely to commit a crime; juvenile with a criminal bent; pre-delinquent juvenile; status offender
虫: (chuu/mushi) - insect , insect, bug, cricket, moth, worm
虫えい: (ちゅうえい) - gall (abnormal plant growth formed by insects)
虫がいい: (むしがいい) - selfish; asking too much
虫がつく: (むしがつく) - to become verminous; to be infested with insects; to begin to keep bad company; to have an (unfavorable, unfavourable) lover
虫が付く: (むしがつく) - to become verminous; to be infested with insects; to begin to keep bad company; to have an (unfavorable, unfavourable) lover
虫が好かない: (むしがすかない) - disliking; having an antipathy to
虫が知らせる: (むしがしらせる) - to forebode; to have a presentiment
虫が良い: (むしがいい) - selfish; asking too much
虫ず: (むしず) - heartburn; strong sense of disgust
虫ずが走る: (むしずがはしる) - to be disgusted with; to loathe
虫とり: (むしとり) - insect catching; bug catching
虫の声: (むしのこえ) - singing of insects (esp. in autumn); sound of insects
虫の居所が悪い: (むしのいどころがわるい) - being in a bad mood
虫の息: (むしのいき) - faint breath; dying whisper; at death's door
虫の音: (むしのね) - calls and sounds made by insects
